TPixelGroup Struct Reference
[Class Pixel group container.]

A group of pixels found by a segmentation algorithm. More...

#include <kernel_pixelgroup.h>


Data Fields

T2DInt Bottom

unsigned int AllocatedPixels
T2DInt * pPos
UINT32 * pColor

Detailed Description

A group of pixels found by a segmentation algorithm.

The segmentation algorithm decides which pixels are to be considered as one group. The Blob-algorithm is one example of a segmentation algorithm.

See also:
TStatistic

Definition at line 45 of file kernel_pixelgroup.h.

unsigned int TPixelGroup::AllocatedPixels
 

Parameters:
AllocatedPixels  (unsigned int) Internal use. Remembers the maximum allocated pixel positions available in the pPos array.

UINT16 TPixelGroup::Bits
 

Parameters:
Bits  per pixel (bit planes): 1,8 or 24. Is set when the function k_AddColors is called.

COLORTYPE TPixelGroup::Color
 

Parameters:
Color  (COLORTYPE) Value HIGHCOLOR if the group is derived from high color pixels otherwise the value is LOWCOLOR. This value may not be used by all algorithms.

Definition at line 56 of file kernel_pixelgroup.h.

UINT32* TPixelGroup::pColor
 

Parameters:
pColor  (UINT32) Colors corresponding to the positions stored in the pPos array. Index i corresponds to position stored in pPos[i]. This array is not allways used, so remember to check if it is a NULL pointer.

Definition at line 70 of file kernel_pixelgroup.h.
